name: Mixed Bag 14 Online Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Tough [E] | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many children did Francis Scott Key have?
questions.explanation:
11.

	He still found time to write the poem 'The Star Spangled Banner' during the War of 1812.

questions.text: For what disease did Albert Sabin find an oral vaccine?
questions.explanation:
Polio.

	This followed an injectable vaccine by Jonas Salk.

questions.text: What Spanish explorer discovered the Mississippi River in 1541?
questions.explanation:
De Soto.

	He explored much of the state of Florida.

questions.text: Who was the host of the TV game show 'Let's Make A Deal'?
questions.explanation:
Monty Hall.

	This show was on NBC from 1963-1968, ABC from 1968-1976 and in syndication from 1984-1986.

questions.text: What is the adulthood span of a Hercules moth?
What was the name of Marilyn Monroe's last film?
questions.explanation:
The Misfits.

	It was made in 1961 and was directed by John Huston.

questions.text: How many palm trees are shown on the front of a pack of camel cigarettes?
questions.explanation:
3.

	Check it out if you can find a pack of Camels.

questions.text: The movies 'State Fair' and 'The Music Man' both take place in which U.S. state?
questions.explanation:
Iowa.

	'State Fair' takes place at the Iowa State Fair and 'The Music Man' takes place in River City.

questions.text: What was Lady Bird Johnson's given first name?
What was the name of Elvis Presley's first movie?
questions.explanation:
Love Me Tender.

	It was in 1956. 'Speedway' was in 1968, 'G. I. Blues' in 1960 and 'Blue Hawaii' in 1961.
